newsitem.title: PANAMA: Evergreen to open Panama port in Sept.
newsitem.headline: Evergreen to open Panama port in Sept.

text.p: Taiwan's shipping giant Evergreen Marine Corp (Taiwan) Ltd plans to open a new $200 million port facility on Panama's Atlantic coast in September, National Port Authority Director Hugo Torrijos said Friday.
Located just outside Colon, some 50 miles (80 km) from Panama City, the 50-acre (20-hectare) facility called Port Coco Solo will be Panama's third private port facility on the Atlantic.
Hong Kong consortium Hutchison Whampoa Ltd won a concession to upgrade Panama's two largest ports, including Cristobal on the Atlantic coast.
Evergreen will invest up to $200 million on Coco Solo, which is expected to move an estimated one million containers per year, a company spokesman said.

During a first phase to July 1997, a 324-meter pier will be built and three cranes will be installed. The second phase, to end-January 1998, will see construction of an additional 312- meter pier and installation of two more cranes.
